description: Curated, quality-ranked external references and learning resources for DSA interview preparation

categories.name: üìö GitHub Repositories
categories.description: Community-curated open source repositories with code, study plans, and solutions

resources.name: Coding Interview University
resources.description: Complete multi-month CS self-study curriculum. The most comprehensive and most starred interview prep repo. Created by an engineer who went from self-taught to Amazon SDE.

resources.name: System Design Primer
resources.description: Learn system design for technical interviews. Covers scalability, databases, caching, load balancing, and real-world architecture. Essential for senior-level interviews.

resources.name: TheAlgorithms/Python
resources.description: Every algorithm implemented in Python for education. 1,263+ contributors. Covers sorting, searching, graphs, DP, math, ML, and more. The largest algorithm implementation collection.

resources.name: javascript-algorithms
resources.description: Algorithms and data structures in JavaScript with explanations and links to further readings. Each algorithm has its own README with complexity analysis. 214+ contributors.

resources.name: Hello Algo
resources.description: Data structures and algorithms crash course with 500+ animated illustrations, code in 14 programming languages, and 3000+ community Q&As. Endorsed by Tsinghua University professors. Beautiful, modern, free online book.

resources.name: Tech Interview Handbook
resources.description: Curated coding interview preparation materials. Created by Yangshun (ex-Meta Staff Engineer, author of Blind 75 & Grind 75). Covers algorithms, behavioral, resume, and negotiation.

resources.name: labuladong ÁÆóÊ≥ïÁ¨îËÆ∞
resources.description: Framework-based algorithm thinking. Teaches you to recognize patterns and build solution templates rather than memorizing individual solutions. Available in English.

resources.name: ‰ª£Á†ÅÈöèÊÉ≥ÂΩï (leetcode-master)
resources.description: Structured learning path from arrays to graphs with detailed explanations and thinking process. Available in Chinese with English translations. Very methodical approach.

resources.name: kdn251/interviews
resources.description: Everything you need for technical interviews. Solutions organized by topic with company tags. Java-focused with comprehensive cheat sheets.

resources.name: LeetcodeTop
resources.description: Company-specific most frequent interview problems from insider data. Regularly updated with real interview frequency data.

resources.name: awesome-leetcode-resources
resources.description: Curated list of LeetCode resources, patterns, must-read articles, YouTube playlists, and LeetCode extensions. Created by AlgoMaster. Covers 15 core patterns and 20 DP patterns.

resources.name: LeetCode Patterns (SeanPrashad)
resources.description: Pattern-based problem organization with interactive website. Filter by pattern, difficulty, and company. A curated list of LeetCode questions grouped by their common patterns.

resources.name: DSA Bootcamp Java (Kunal Kushwaha)
resources.description: Complete DSA bootcamp with free YouTube video course. Assignments and lecture notes for each topic. Community-driven with active Discord.

resources.name: CS-Notes (CyC2018)
resources.description: Comprehensive technical interview knowledge base covering LeetCode solutions, OS, networking, databases, and system design. One of the most starred repos on all of GitHub.

resources.name: doocs/leetcode
resources.description: LeetCode solutions in every major programming language including JavaScript, Java, Go, C#, C++, and Python3. Also includes Sword to Offer and Programmer Interview Classic problems.

resources.name: LeetCode-Go (halfrost)
resources.description: LeetCode solutions in Go with 100% test coverage and runtime beats 100%. By a senior engineer at ByteDance. Each solution is tested and benchmarked.

resources.name: LeetCodeAnimation
resources.description: LeetCode problems explained through animations. Visual step-by-step algorithm walkthroughs. Great for understanding how algorithms work before implementing them.

resources.name: The Complete FAANG Preparation
resources.description: All-in-one repository covering DSA, Love Babbar's 450, Striver's sheet, OS, DBMS, SQL, Computer Networks, and OOP. A meta-resource linking to curated problem lists and CS fundamentals.

resources.name: LeetCode Company-Wise Problems
resources.description: Lists of company-specific LeetCode problems based on premium company tags. Regularly updated CSV files for Google, Meta, Amazon, Microsoft, and dozens more companies.

resources.name: TheAlgorithms/JavaScript
resources.description: All algorithms implemented in JavaScript for beginners, following best practices. Covers data structures, sorting, searching, cryptography, math, and more. Community-driven.

resources.name: algorithm-pattern (greyireland)
resources.description: Algorithm template-based learning: the most scientific way to practice LeetCode. Provides reusable templates for binary search, BFS/DFS, DP, and more. Go-based implementations.

resources.name: CtCI-6th-Edition Solutions
resources.description: Official crowd-sourced solutions to Cracking the Coding Interview (6th Edition). Companion to the CTCI book with solutions in multiple languages.

categories.name: üìã Curated Problem Lists
categories.description: Essential problem sets with strategic ordering for interview preparation

resources.name: Blind 75
resources.description: The original 75 problems that cover all major coding patterns. Created by Yangshun (then FB engineer) and shared on Blind. The gold standard minimum set. If you solve only one list, make it this one.

resources.name: Grind 75
resources.description: The modern evolution of Blind 75 by the same author. Fully customizable: set your time per week, number of weeks, and preferred topics. Generates an optimal study schedule.

resources.name: NeetCode 150
resources.description: Extended Blind 75 with video explanations for every single problem. Organized by topic with a visual roadmap. Free video solutions on YouTube. The most recommended list on r/leetcode.

resources.name: NeetCode 250
resources.description: The comprehensive NeetCode set with all 250 curated problems. Extends the 150 with deeper coverage of each topic for thorough mastery.

resources.name: Striver's SDE Sheet
resources.description: 191 hand-picked problems for SDE interviews with free video solutions. Created by Raj Vikramaditya (Striver) who has worked at Google. Very popular globally.

resources.name: Striver's A2Z DSA Sheet
resources.description: 455 problems covering DSA from absolute basics to advanced. The most comprehensive free structured problem set. Each problem has video solution and article explanation.

resources.name: AlgoMaster 300
resources.description: 300 problems organized by 15 core patterns. By Ashish (AlgoMaster blog). Includes pattern explanations with each problem grouping. Modern and well-maintained.

resources.name: LeetCode Top 100 Liked
resources.description: The 100 most liked problems on LeetCode by the community. These are the problems people find most educational and interview-representative.

resources.name: LeetCode Top Interview 150
resources.description: LeetCode's official curated interview preparation list. Organized by topic with difficulty progression. Built-in progress tracking on LeetCode.

resources.name: LeetCode Patterns
resources.description: Interactive website to filter and organize LeetCode problems by pattern. Filter by pattern type, difficulty, and company. Clean, fast interface.

resources.name: LeetCode 75
resources.description: LeetCode's official curated 75-problem study plan covering essential topics with progressive difficulty. Built-in progress tracking. Great alternative to Blind 75 with official LeetCode integration.

resources.name: NeetCode Practice (Core Skills)
resources.description: 95 implementation-focused problems for data structures, algorithms, sorting, graphs, and DP. Build common data structures from scratch. Includes SQL and design patterns sections.

categories.name: üé• Video Resources
categories.description: YouTube channels and video series for visual and auditory learners

resources.name: NeetCode
resources.description: The #1 LeetCode YouTube channel. Clean explanations with code walkthroughs, pattern recognition, and optimal solutions. Previously at Google & Amazon. Every NeetCode 150/250 problem has a free video.

resources.name: Abdul Bari
resources.description: The gold standard for algorithm fundamentals. Legendary whiteboard-style teaching with dry run examples. Best for understanding the 'why' behind algorithms, not just the 'how'.

resources.name: take U forward (Striver)
resources.description: Complete DSA course from basics to advanced by ex-Google engineer. Accompanies the A2Z and SDE sheets. Very thorough with multiple approaches per problem. Great for all tech interviews.

resources.name: William Fiset
resources.description: Best resource for graph algorithms and advanced data structures. Beautiful animations and clear visualizations. Former Google engineer. His graph playlist is unmatched.

resources.name: Tushar Roy - Coding Made Simple
resources.description: Classic DP and algorithm explanations. Whiteboard style teaching. One of the original algorithm YouTube channels. His DP playlist is legendary.

resources.name: Back To Back SWE
resources.description: Interview-focused explanations with emphasis on how to communicate your solution. Teaches the soft skills of technical interviews alongside the hard skills.

resources.name: AlgoMaster (Ashish)
resources.description: Pattern-focused DSA videos with clean animations. Companion to the AlgoMaster blog. Covers all major patterns with code examples in multiple languages.

resources.name: Errichto
resources.description: Competitive programming legend (top-rated on Codeforces). Advanced algorithms and contest-style problem solving. Great for those who want to go beyond interview-level.

resources.name: Michael Sambol
resources.description: Ultra-short algorithm review videos (2-5 minutes each). Perfect for quick review and spaced repetition. 48+ short videos covering all major topics.

resources.name: CS Dojo
resources.description: Beginner-friendly algorithm and Python tutorials by YK Sugi (ex-Google intern). Extremely clear explanations of fundamentals. Great first introduction to DSA concepts.

resources.name: mycodeschool
resources.description: Classic DSA channel with whiteboard-style explanations of pointers, linked lists, trees, and sorting. Created by the late Harsha Suryanarayana. Timeless content still widely recommended.

resources.name: Inside Code
resources.description: Modern algorithm animations with clean visuals. Short, focused videos covering individual algorithms and data structures. Great production quality.

resources.name: Pepcoding
resources.description: Comprehensive Java-based DSA course with structured playlists. Strong focus on recursion, DP, and graph theory. Popular in Indian tech prep community with very thorough explanations.

resources.name: TECH DOSE
resources.description: LeetCode problem solutions with clear C++ implementations. Covers daily challenges and interview problems. Good explanations of time/space complexity.

categories.name: üìñ Articles, Handbooks & Interactive Tools
categories.description: Written guides, reference materials, visualization tools, and interactive learning platforms

resources.name: Tech Interview Handbook
resources.description: Free curated interview preparation materials by Yangshun (ex-Meta Staff Engineer, Blind 75 author). Covers algorithms cheatsheets, behavioral interviews, resume writing, and salary negotiation. The most comprehensive free interview guide.

resources.name: Hello Algo (Free Online Book)
resources.description: Beautiful free DSA textbook with 500+ animated illustrations, code in 14 languages, and community Q&A. Endorsed by professors from Tsinghua University and senior scientists from Amazon. 122K+ GitHub stars.

resources.name: Big-O Cheat Sheet
resources.description: The definitive complexity reference. Covers time and space complexity for all major data structures and sorting algorithms in one visual page. Bookmark this.

resources.name: VisuAlgo
resources.description: Interactive algorithm visualizations for all major data structures and algorithms. Step through algorithms at your own pace. Created by Dr Steven Halim at NUS. The best visualization tool for DSA.

resources.name: GeeksforGeeks
resources.description: Largest collection of DSA articles with implementations in 5+ languages. Covers everything from basics to advanced. Also has practice problems, company interview corners, and quizzes.

resources.name: roadmap.sh - DSA Roadmap
resources.description: Interactive visual roadmap for learning DSA. Track your progress through 107 topics. The 6th most starred project on all of GitHub (349K+ stars). Has AI tutor integration.

resources.name: Algorithm Visualizer
resources.description: Interactive platform for visualizing algorithms from code. Write code and see it execute step-by-step. Open source with community contributions.

resources.name: CP-Algorithms (e-maxx)
resources.description: Comprehensive algorithms encyclopedia translated from the legendary Russian e-maxx. Covers advanced topics with mathematical proofs and implementations. The go-to for competitive programming.

resources.name: AlgoMaster Blog
resources.description: Newsletter-style blog by Ashish covering 15 LeetCode patterns, 20 DP patterns, and DSA mastery tips. Concise, practical articles focused on interview patterns.

resources.name: LeetCode Discuss (Study Guides)
resources.description: Community-created study guides on LeetCode Discuss. Includes legendary posts like 'DP Patterns', 'Binary Search Template', 'Sliding Window Template', and 'Two Pointers patterns'. Invaluable community knowledge.

resources.name: NeetCode Roadmap
resources.description: Visual, interactive topic roadmap showing dependencies between DSA topics. See what to learn in what order. Free to use with progress tracking.

resources.name: Python Tutor (Visualize Code Execution)
resources.description: Visualize code execution step-by-step in Python, Java, C, C++, and JavaScript. See memory allocation, stack frames, and pointer references. The best tool for understanding recursion and data structures in memory.

resources.name: Data Structure Visualizations (USFCA)
resources.description: Interactive visualizations for all major data structures and algorithms by Prof. David Galles at USF. Covers BST, AVL, B-trees, heaps, graphs, sorting, and more. Academic quality.

resources.name: InterviewBit Practice & Guides
resources.description: Structured 8-level DSA programming course with 615 problems, articles, and guided learning path. Includes tutorials for each topic. Free with gamification and leaderboards.

resources.name: Sorting Algorithms Visualizer
resources.description: Beautiful side-by-side sorting algorithm comparisons with audio. Watch bubble sort, merge sort, quicksort, and more race against each other. Great for building intuition about sorting performance.

categories.name: üìï Books
categories.description: Essential books for deep understanding and interview mastery

resources.name: Cracking the Coding Interview (CTCI)
resources.author: Gayle Laakmann McDowell
resources.description: The bible of coding interviews. 189 problems with detailed solutions, plus chapters on behavioral interviews, big O, and specific company prep. Written by an ex-Google, ex-Microsoft, ex-Apple interviewer.

resources.name: Elements of Programming Interviews
resources.author: Aziz, Lee, Prakash
resources.description: 300 problems with deep solutions. Available in Python, Java, and C++. More challenging than CTCI. The book for those aiming at Google/Meta-level interviews.

resources.name: The Algorithm Design Manual
resources.author: Steven Skiena
resources.description: Part textbook, part algorithm catalog. Great stories from industry and academia. The algorithm catalog is invaluable for knowing which algorithm to apply to which problem type.

resources.name: Introduction to Algorithms (CLRS)
resources.author: Cormen, Leiserson, Rivest, Stein
resources.description: The definitive algorithms textbook used by universities worldwide. 4th edition (2022). Extremely thorough with mathematical rigor. Not necessary for interviews, but unmatched for deep understanding.

resources.name: Coding Interview Patterns
resources.author: Alex Xu & Sahn Lam
resources.description: Pattern-based approach with 101 real coding interview problems. 1000+ diagrams. Intuitive explanations guiding you through each problem as if in a live interview. Recommended by the Coding Interview University repo.

resources.name: Grokking Algorithms
resources.author: Aditya Bhargava
resources.description: Illustrated guide to algorithms for beginners. Uses comics and visual explanations. Makes complex topics approachable. Great first algorithms book before diving deeper.

resources.name: Algorithms (4th Edition)
resources.author: Robert Sedgewick & Kevin Wayne
resources.description: Companion to the Princeton Coursera course. Free booksite with Java implementations, visualizations, and exercises. Covers fundamental algorithms with elegant, readable code.

resources.name: Competitive Programmer's Handbook
resources.author: Antti Laaksonen
resources.description: Free PDF covering algorithms and data structures used in competitive programming. 300 pages of concise, practical content. Goes beyond interview-level into advanced topics like segment trees and FFT.

resources.name: Programming Pearls
resources.author: Jon Bentley
resources.description: Classic book on algorithmic thinking and problem-solving. Teaches how to think about algorithm design with real-world examples. Short, elegant, and insightful.

categories.name: üéì Courses (Free & Paid)
categories.description: Structured courses for systematic learning with guided curriculum

resources.name: NeetCode.io Courses
resources.description: Structured courses: 'Algorithms & DS for Beginners' (25 hours) and 'Advanced Algorithms' (25 hours). Built-in code runner with Python. By the creator of NeetCode (ex-Google). Free tier includes NeetCode 150.

resources.name: Grokking the Coding Interview
resources.description: The gold standard for pattern-based interview prep. Covers 26 coding patterns with 100+ problems. Interactive coding in Java, Python, C++, and JavaScript. Created by Design Gurus.

resources.name: AlgoMonster
resources.description: Fastest path to mastering DSA. Data-driven approach analyzing thousands of interview questions. Built-in spaced repetition. By Google engineers. One-time payment, lifetime access.

resources.name: Algorithms I & II (Princeton/Coursera)
resources.description: Robert Sedgewick's legendary algorithms course from Princeton. Covers sorting, searching, graphs, and strings with Java. Free to audit. Considered one of the best CS courses ever made.

resources.name: MIT 6.006: Introduction to Algorithms
resources.description: MIT's flagship algorithms course. 47 lectures covering all fundamental algorithms. Free on YouTube with course materials on MIT OCW. Taught by Erik Demaine and others.

resources.name: Educative.io
resources.description: Interactive text-based courses with in-browser coding. Multiple DSA and system design courses. No video - learn by reading and coding. Includes Grokking courses.

resources.name: LeetCode Premium
resources.description: Access to company-tagged problems with frequency data, official solutions, and mock interview features. See which problems Google, Meta, Amazon ask most frequently.

resources.name: Master the Coding Interview (ZTM/Udemy)
resources.description: Udemy bestseller with 4.6 stars, 21.5k ratings, 135k students. 19 hours covering data structures, algorithms, plus resume, behavioral, and negotiation. JavaScript-based.

resources.name: AlgoExpert
resources.description: 200 hand-picked problems with 100+ hours of video explanations. Solutions in 9 languages. Built-in coding workspace, mock interviews, and curated assessments. Created by Cl√©ment Mihailescu (ex-Google, ex-Meta). 200K+ users.

resources.name: Stanford Algorithms (Coursera)
resources.description: Tim Roughgarden's 4-course algorithms specialization from Stanford. Covers divide & conquer, graph search, shortest paths, greedy, DP, and NP-completeness. Excellent theoretical foundation.

resources.name: CS Video Courses (Developer-Y)
resources.description: Curated list of CS video courses from top universities worldwide. Covers algorithms, data structures, OS, networking, databases, and more. 69K+ GitHub stars. The meta-resource for finding free CS lectures.

categories.name: üõ†Ô∏è Practice Platforms & Tools
categories.description: Platforms for coding practice, mock interviews, and assessment preparation

resources.name: LeetCode
resources.description: The undisputed standard for coding interview practice. 3000+ problems. Contest system, discuss forums, company tags, study plans. If you use only one platform, use this one.

resources.name: HackerRank
resources.description: Great for learning with structured tracks (30 Days of Code, Interview Preparation Kit). Also used by many companies for actual hiring assessments. Good certifications.

resources.name: Codeforces
resources.description: The premier competitive programming platform. Regular contests with global ranking. Problems from Div.1 (hard) to Div.4 (beginner). Great for sharpening problem-solving speed.

resources.name: Codewars
resources.description: Gamified coding challenges with 'kata' ranking system (8kyu to 1kyu). Supports 55+ languages. Fun for daily practice and maintaining coding skills.

resources.name: interviewing.io
resources.description: Anonymous mock interviews with senior engineers from FAANG companies. Real interview experience with real feedback. Also has recorded mock interviews you can watch for free.

resources.name: Pramp
resources.description: Free peer-to-peer mock interviews. You interview each other - great for practicing both sides of the table. Structured format with provided questions.

resources.name: Hello Interview
resources.description: Mock interviews with AI or FAANG staff engineers and managers. Practice system design and coding interviews with immediate feedback.

resources.name: Excalidraw
resources.description: Free virtual whiteboard for drawing algorithm diagrams. Perfect for system design practice and explaining algorithms visually. Hand-drawn feel, easy to use.

resources.name: InterviewBit
resources.description: Structured 8-level DSA course with 615 problems, gamification, leaderboards, and streaks. Covers time complexity through graphs. Free with optional Scaler Academy upgrade. Also conducts hiring challenges.

resources.name: CodeChef
resources.description: Popular competitive programming platform with monthly contests (Long, Cook-Off, Lunchtime). Great practice problems across all difficulty levels. Strong community especially in India.

resources.name: AtCoder
resources.description: Japanese competitive programming platform with very well-designed problems. Weekly contests with strong editorial explanations. Beginner Contest (ABC) is great for interview-level problems.

resources.name: CodeSignal
resources.description: Used by many companies for actual coding assessments. Practice their assessment format to prepare for real screening rounds. Has arcade mode for fun daily practice.

resources.name: Project Euler
resources.description: 900+ mathematical/programming challenges. Not interview-specific, but excellent for developing mathematical thinking and number theory skills that help with hard interview problems.

categories.name: üìã Cheatsheets & Quick References
categories.description: Quick-reference materials for review and last-minute preparation

resources.name: Tech Interview Handbook - Algorithm Cheatsheets
resources.description: Study guides for 19 DSA topics with time complexities, corner cases, useful techniques, and recommended practice questions. The most practical cheatsheet collection for interviews.

resources.name: AlgoMonster Pattern Cheatsheet
resources.description: Data-driven analysis of interview question patterns with frequency statistics. Shows which patterns appear most often based on thousands of real interviews.

resources.name: 15 LeetCode Patterns
resources.description: Concise guide to the 15 most important coding patterns. Each pattern with problem recognition signals, template code, and example problems. Great for pattern review.

resources.name: 20 Dynamic Programming Patterns
resources.description: Comprehensive guide to 20 DP patterns including 0/1 Knapsack, LCS, LIS, Matrix Chain, and more. Each with template and example problems.

resources.name: Data Structure Sketches
resources.description: Beautiful hand-drawn sketches of all major data structures. Great for visual review and understanding the conceptual structure of each data type.

resources.name: Grind 75 (Customizable Study Plan Generator)
resources.description: Free tool by Yangshun (Blind 75 author) that generates personalized LeetCode study plans. Set your available hours, weeks, and topics. Outputs an optimal weekly schedule with 75 problems. The modern replacement for Blind 75.

resources.name: 14 Coding Interview Patterns
resources.description: The seminal article by Fahim ul Haq (Design Gurus founder) that popularized pattern-based interview prep. Covers sliding window, two pointers, fast/slow pointers, merge intervals, and more.

resources.name: DSA Roadmap & Complexity Cheatsheet
resources.description: Interactive visual roadmap covering 107 DSA topics with explanations for each. Track your progress, mark items complete, and see learning dependencies. 349K+ GitHub stars.

studyPlans.name: 2-Week Emergency Sprint
studyPlans.description: Interview in 2 weeks? Focus on highest-ROI patterns only
studyPlans.focus: Two Pointers, Sliding Window, BFS/DFS, Binary Search, Hash Map. Skip hard problems. Focus on pattern recognition over problem count.
strategy: Week 1: Arrays, Strings, Hash Maps, Two Pointers, Sliding Window (Easy+Medium only)
Week 2: Trees, Graphs (BFS/DFS), Binary Search, Stack/Queue, review weak areas

studyPlans.name: 4-Week Sprint
studyPlans.description: Solid preparation covering all essential patterns
studyPlans.focus: Complete Blind 75. Watch NeetCode video for each problem. Review complexity cheatsheets. Do 2-3 mock interviews.
strategy: Week 1: Arrays, Two Pointers, Sliding Window, Stack (20 problems)
Week 2: Binary Search, Linked List, Trees (20 problems)
Week 3: Graphs, Heaps, Intervals, Greedy (20 problems)
Week 4: DP basics, Backtracking, review + mock interviews (15 problems)

studyPlans.name: 8-Week Comprehensive
studyPlans.description: Thorough preparation with depth in all topics
studyPlans.focus: Master all major patterns with video explanations. Include system design basics for mid-level+. Regular mock interviews.
strategy: Weeks 1-2: Arrays, Strings, Hash Maps, Two Pointers, Sliding Window
Weeks 3-4: Stacks, Queues, Linked Lists, Binary Search
Weeks 7-8: DP, Greedy, Intervals, Tries, review + 4 mock interviews

studyPlans.name: 16-Week Mastery Path
studyPlans.description: Deep preparation for top companies (Google, Meta, etc.)
studyPlans.focus: Complete coverage with advanced topics. System design preparation. Multiple approaches per problem. Regular mock interviews with feedback.
strategy: Weeks 1-4: Foundations (Arrays, Strings, Recursion, Sorting, Searching)
Weeks 5-8: Core DS (Trees, Graphs, Heaps, Tries, Hash Maps)
Weeks 9-12: Advanced Patterns (DP, Backtracking, Greedy, Bit Manipulation)
Weeks 13-14: System Design basics + Hard problems
Weeks 15-16: Review, mock interviews (8+), company-specific practice
